author: Staff Reporter
text:
Four government buses were hypothecated on the orders of Harur Sub-Court here after failure to compensate an accident victim.

The orders were passed after Tamil Nadu State Transport Corporation failed to compensate an accident victim, who was fatally knocked down by a TNSTC bus here in Harur in 2013. The victim Shekar (38), a construction worker, was returning from work, when he was hit by a government bus.

Harur Sub-Court, hearing the plea of the victim’s wife, had ordered TNSTC to pay up Rs.9.88 lakh as compensation.

However, the TNSTC failed to pay up, and a follow-up order was passed to pay up Rs.11.97 lakh as compensation to the victim’s family in 2014.

Repeated failure

On Wednesday, taking cognisance of the State Corporation’s repeated failure to pay up the compensation, Judge Jothi passed the orders to hypothecate four TNSTC buses that were parked in Harur bus stand. Following the orders, the buses were seized.
title: TNSTC buses hypothecated
